Companies That Need New Names

24 Jun 2011

 

Wall.E  featured the fictional Buy N’ Large Corporation as its evil corporate giant (read: Walmart stand-in)

But these companies’ names are the real deal.  Their names could either point to the fact that they’re refreshingly transparent or blatantly evil. You decide.

GiantFood is a supermarket chain–btw, their corporate philanthropy is raising money for cancer

ChemInc is a water treatment company. Mmmm. Chemical water.

Grim Corporation sells furniture in New Jersey. Way to *not *brighten up your home.

Not surprisingly Bogus Oil Inc. has had some service complaints. Apparently they’re not very reliable.

Have you stumbled on any companies with equally revealing names? Chemical, big or untrustworthy sounding? Send ‘em along. Photos too!

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada, and if you don’t know what that is, it’s time you do. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
